question:
Three of the following number-pairs are alike in some manner and hence form a group. Which number-pair does not belong to that group?
(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13-Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)
solution:
(a)
Logic:- (1stno.+2)2 = 3rd no.
(8 : 100):- (8 + 2)2 ⇒ (10)2 = 100
(9 : 121):- (9 + 2)2 ⇒ (11)2 = 121
(6 : 64):- (6 + 2)2 ⇒ (8)2 = 64
but
(12 : 225):- (12 + 2)2 ⇒ (14)2= 196 ≠ 225

question:
Two sets of numbers are given below. In each set of numbers, certain mathematical operation(s) on the first number result(s) in the second number. Similarly, certain mathematical operation(s) on the second number result(s) in the third number and so on. Which of the given options follows the same set of operations as in the given sets?
(NOTE: Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into their constituent digits. E.g. 13 - Operations on 13 such as adding/subtracting/multiplying to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed.)
8 - 33 - 66 - 81 ; 11 - 36 - 72 - 87
solution:
(b)
Logic;- 1stno. + 25 = 2nd no. , 2nd no. × 2 = 3rd no., 3rd no. + 15 = 4thno.
(8 - 33 - 66 - 81) :- 8 + 25 = 33, 33 × 2 = 66, 66 + 15 = 81
(11 - 36 - 72 - 87) :- 11 + 25 = 36, 36 × 2 = 72, 72 + 15 = 87
Similarly
(15 - 40 - 80 - 95) :- 15 + 25 = 40, 40 × 2 = 80, 80 + 15 = 95

question:
Select the set in which the numbers are related in the same way as are the numbers of the following sets.
(NOTE : Operations should be performed on the whole numbers, without breaking down the numbers into its constituent digits. E.g. 13- Operations on 13 such as adding /deleting /multiplying etc. to 13 can be performed. Breaking down 13 into 1 and 3 and then performing mathematical operations on 1 and 3 is not allowed)
(288, 144, 24)
(432, 216, 36)
solution:
(c) Logic :- (1st number - 2nd number) ÷ 6 = 3rd number
(288 , 144, 24) :- (288 - 144) ÷ 6 ⇒ (144) ÷ 6 = 24
(432, 216 , 36) :- (432 - 216) ÷ 6 ⇒ (216) ÷ 6 = 36
Similarly,
(504 , 252, 42) :- (504 - 252)÷ 6 ⇒ (252) ÷ 6 = 42

(d)

Three people sit between O and N when counted from the right of O.

(All turns are 90 degrees turns only unless specified.)

solution:
(c) Given:- FROWNED
As per given instruction after arranging the letter in alphabetical order we get
DEFNORW. Fourth from the left is N and second to the right is R. Number of letters between N and R is 3.

question: The sum of the present ages of a father and son is 50 years. If after 5 years, the father’s age will be 5 times the age of the son, then what was the father’s age 5 years ago?
solution:
(a)
Let father’s present age = x year
Then son’s age = (50 - x) years
According to question, after 5 years
5 (50 - x + 5) = (x + 5)
275 - 5x = x + 5
6x = 270 ⇒ x = 45 years
Father’s age 5 years ago = 45 - 5 = 40 years

question: If 26 November 2013 was Tuesday, then what was the day of the week on 29 November 2018?
solution:
(d) 26 November 2013 was Tuesday. On moving to 2018 the number of odd days =
+1 + 1 + 2 + 1 + 1 = 6. We have reached till 26 November, but we have to reach till 29 November.
The number of days in between = 3.
Total number of days = 6 + 3 = 9.
On dividing 9 by 7, the remainder is 2 ⇒ Tuesday + 2 = Thursday.

question:
'Obstinate' is related to 'Stubborn' in the same way as 'Resolute' is related to '__________’ .
(The words must be considered as meaningful English words and must not be related to each other based on the number of letters/number of consonants/vowels in the word.)
solution:
(a)
As stubborn is the synonym of obstinate, similarly ‘Determined’ is the synonym of Resolute.

question: The ____________ is a cricket shot in which the batsman swings his bat vertically and hits the ball along the ground. The ball is hit between cover and mid-off.
solution: (c) Off drive. Other shots of Cricket : On Drive - It can be used to rotate the strike and hit occasional boundaries. Straight drive - It effectively combines all three methods to produce an aesthetically pleasing shot. Front Foot Defense - It is a deliberate shot that aims to prevent the ball from hitting the wicket or the player's pads.

question: If a bar magnet is hung from a string, in which direction does its north pole point?
solution: (b) North. When a bar magnet is hung freely from a string, its north pole aligns with the Earth's magnetic field and points toward the Earth's magnetic north pole. This happens because opposite magnetic poles attract; since the Earth's magnetic north pole is actually a magnetic south pole, it attracts the north pole of the magnet, causing it to point north.

question: Who among the following was the founder of ‘Vikramshila Vishwavidyalaya’?
solution: (b) Dharmapala. He was the son of Gopala (founder of Pala Dynasty). He revived Nalanda University. He constructed the Somapura Mahavihara at Paharpur. Art and Architecture of Palas - Vikramshila Vihar, Odantpuri Vihar, and Jagaddal Vihar. Vikramashila was one of the two most crucial centers of learning in India during the Pala Empire, along with Nalanda.

question: Which of the following novels was written by George Orwell?
solution: (c) Animal Farm. George Orwell's other notable works : “Burmese Days (1934)”, “Coming Up for Air (1939)”, “Down and Out in Paris and London (1933)”. ‘Brave New World” is written by Aldous Huxley (1932), “Fahrenheit 451” is written by Ray Bradbury (1953), “Pride and Prejudice” is written by Jane Austen (1813).

question: A javelin thrown by an athlete is in ________ motion.
solution: (d) curvilinear. This is because the javelin follows a curved trajectory due to the influence of gravity and the initial angle of release. Curvilinear motion refers to the motion of a particle along a curved path. Oscillatory motion: Repeated back-and-forth motion (Example - A swinging pendulum). Periodic motion: Motion repeating in regular intervals (Example - Rotation of the earth around the sun). Rectilinear motion: Motion in a straight line (Example - An object falling straight down).

question: Which military officer led the British forces in the Battle of Chinhat fought in 1857?
solution: (c) Henry Lawrence. The Battle of Chinhat took place on the morning of June 30, 1857, near the village of Chinhat in Awadh (now Uttar Pradesh), specifically at Ismailganj, where British forces clashed with Indian rebels during the Indian Rebellion of 1857.

question: Which of the following decomposition reactions is NOT a redox reaction?
solution: (d) Decomposition of calcium carbonate. A redox reaction is defined as a reaction in which oxidation and reduction take place simultaneously. The decomposition of calcium carbonate (CaCO3) into calcium oxide (CaO) and carbon dioxide (CO2) does not involve a change in the oxidation states of the elements involved, making it a non-redox reaction.

question: Who was the freedom fighter and member of the Mewar Praja Mandal who passed away at the age of 102?
solution: (a) Madan Mohan Somtiya. A freedom fighter and member of the Mewar Praja Mandal, played a key role in India's independence movement, including the Quit India Movement. Known for his acts of defiance, he assisted in blackening Queen Victoria's statue in Udaipur as a protest.

question: Which of the following is NOT an Indian tournament?
solution: (a) UEFA Champions League. It is an annual club football competition organized by the Union of European Football Associations (UEFA) and contested by top-division European clubs. It was founded in 1955. Some prominent football trophies in India include the Durand Cup, Santosh Trophy, Federation Cup, I-League Trophy, Indian Super League (ISL) Trophy, IFA Shield, Rovers Cup, Sait Nagjee Trophy, Subroto Cup, and Bordoloi Trophy.

question: Which plateaus are very fertile because they are rich in black soil that is very good for farming?
solution: (d) Deccan lava plateau is a volcanic plateau in west-central India that was formed by the solidification of lava from deep within the Earth. It is a triangular landmass that lies to the south of the river Narmada. The African plateau is famous for gold and diamond mining. The Katanga Plateau in the Democratic Republic of the Congo is known for its rich deposits of copper and uranium.

question: What is the IUPAC name of tertiarybutyl alcohol?
solution: (a) 2-Methylpropan-2-ol. Tertiary Butyl Alcohol, also Tert-butyl alcohol, is a tertiary alcohol used in fuels and fuel additives, intermediates and laboratory chemicals. It is a colorless oily liquid with a sharp alcohol odor.

question: Natya Sangeet is a form of musical play in classical music still prevalent in Maharashtra. Bal Gandharava is an exponent of this musical form. What is actual name of Balgandharva?
solution: (b) Narayan Shripad Rajhans. He was a renowned Marathi singer and stage actor, famous for portraying female characters in Marathi plays at a time when women were not permitted to act on stage. Natya Sangeet is a form of drama that combines prose and poetry through songs to convey the story, akin to musicals. The term "Dramatic Music" refers to Natya Sangeet, one of the two popular forms of vocal arts in Maharashtra and neighboring states, the other being Bhavageet.

question: Which of the following is the transboundary river between India and Pakistan?
solution: (b) Ravi. This river flows through north-western India and eastern Pakistan. It, along with the Beas and Sutlej rivers, was allocated to India under the Indus Water Treaty. Indus River : This river originates in western Tibet, passes through Kashmir, and flows into Pakistan before falling into the Arabian Sea. It, along with the Chenab and Jhelum rivers, was allocated to Pakistan under the Indus Water Treaty of 1960.

question: Who developed the technique of preserving the quality of food by raising its temperature to prevent microbial growth in the food?
solution: (d) Louis Pasteur. He was a French biologist who is often regarded as the father of modern microbiology. Scientists and their discoveries: Antonie van Leeuwenhoek - Microbiology, Charles Darwin - Theory of evolution, Robert Koch - Tuberculosis bacterium, Barbara McClintock - Jumping genes, Watson and Crick - DNA structure.

question: In which of the following states is the Behdienkhlam festival celebrated in the month of July ?
solution: (a) Meghalaya. Behdienkhlam (chasing away the Demon of Cholera) is celebrated annually in July after the sowing period, the most important dance festival of the Jaintia tribes. Other famous Festivals : Meghalaya - Wangala, Nongkrem, Shad Suk Mynsiem, Shad Sukra. Haryana - Guga Navmi, Gita Jayanti. West Bengal - Shiber Gajan, Disum sendra, Rohini Utsav. Bihar - Chhath Puja, Bihula, Karama.

question: Dr. B. R. Ambedkar described Directive Principles of State Policy as __________of the Indian constitution.
option_3: The most precious part of the constitution
solution: (d) a novel feature of the Indian constitution. The Directive Principles of State Policy (DPSP) are outlined in Part IV (Articles 36-51) of the Indian Constitution and are inspired by the Constitution of Ireland. They represent the ideals that the State should consider while formulating policies and enacting laws to promote social and economic justice.

question: Which of the following statements about eutrophication is correct?
option_1:
It happens when too much nitrogen enriches the water, causing excessive growth of plants and
algae.
option_2: It happens when too much carbon enriches the water, causing excessive growth of bacteria and reduced growth of plants.
option_3: It happens when too less nitrogen is present in the water, causing reduced growth of plants and algae.
option_4: It is a beneficial process for environment restoration.
solution: (a) Eutrophication. It is the process where excess nutrients, particularly nitrogen and phosphorus, lead to an overgrowth of algae and aquatic plants. This growth can deplete oxygen in the water, harming aquatic life.

question: Who authored the book ‘Maa - Mother’, launched on November 12, 2024?
solution: (a) Dr. Davendra Kumar Dhodawat. The book, a collection of poems in Hindi and English, celebrates the essence of motherhood and was launched in New Delhi by Law and Justice Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal

question: Which Indian award was established in the year 1982, to promote and encourage scientific efforts in the field of environment and ecology ?
option_2: Sanjay Gandhi Award for Environment and Ecology
option_3: B P Pal National Environment Fellowship Award for Biodiversity
solution: (b) The Sanjay Gandhi Award for Environment and Ecology is awarded annually to an individual citizen of India engaged in scientific work in the field. It includes a cash prize of ₹100,000, with the announcement made in May or June of the following year. Eligibility is open to all Indian citizens.

question: Which of the following is mentioned in Article 1 of the Indian constitution?
option_1: India that is Bharat as federation of states
option_2: India that is Bharat as parliamentary democracy
option_3: India that is Bharat shall be a Union of states
option_4: India that is Bharat as presidential form of democracy
solution: (c) Article 1 of the Indian Constitution states, "India, that is Bharat, shall be a Union of States," signifying that India is a federation where states possess certain powers, but the central government holds ultimate authority. Although the Preamble describes India as a sovereign, socialist, secular, democratic republic, it does not explicitly refer to India as a Union of States.

question: The CPWD along with the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways works for public infrastructure. What is the full form of CPWD?
solution: (d) The Central Public Works Department (CPWD) operates under the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs of India. It acts as the builder, developer, and manager of Central government properties. Over time, its operations have expanded to include roadways and bridge engineering. Established in 1854, its headquarters is located in the Central Secretariat in New Delhi.

question: What challenge does foreign investment often face in India?
solution: (b) Inconsistent regulatory environment can lead to difficulties in compliance and planning for investors, ultimately affecting their confidence and willingness to invest in the country. Foreign investment refers to when an investor from one country purchases ownership of an asset or business in another country.

question: Which geostationary weather satellite launched by the European Space Agency in 1977 that provides weather imaging of Earth at both visible light and infrared wavelengths?
solution: (b) Meteosat - The first European geostationary weather satellite, launched in November 1977 by the European Space Agency (ESA). Himawari is a Japanese weather satellite series. QuikSCAT was a NASA satellite that measured ocean winds. Landsat is a series of Earth observation satellites focused on land use, geology, and natural resources, not specifically weather imaging.

question: What is the empirically fitted relationship between the rate of change of money, wage, and rate of unemployment known as ?
solution: (d) Phillips curve states that inflation and unemployment have an inverse relationship; higher inflation is associated with lower unemployment and vice versa. This concept was first proposed by Alban William Phillips. Friedman’s model: Milton Friedman's monetary policy model, focusing on monetary supply and demand. Keynesian model: John Maynard Keynes' macroeconomic model, emphasizing government intervention and aggregate demand. Baumol hypothesis: William Baumol's theory on the relationship between inflation and economic growth.

question: What is the name of the multi-layer clothing system unveiled by DRDO in January 2025 ?
solution: (b) HIMKAVACH, a multi-layered clothing system designed to protect soldiers in extreme temperatures (-60°C to +20°C). It offers insulation, breathability, and moisture protection, with outer layers repelling water and wind, and inner layers trapping heat.

question: If 3c2933k is divisible by both 5 and 11, where c and k are single digit natural numbers, then c + k = ______.
solution:
(a)
Divisibility of 11: The difference of the sum of digits at odd position and sum of digits at even position in a number is 0 or divisible by 11.
Now, (3 + 2 + 3 + k) - (c + 9 + 3) = 0
⇒ (8 + k) = (c + 12) ……(i)
Divisibility of 5: If the last digit of the number should be 0 or 5 then that number will be divisible by 5.
Value of k = 5 (given we take only natural no.)
Put value of k in equation (i), we get
⇒ (8 + 5) = (c + 12)
⇒ c = 13 - 12 = 1
So,
c + k = 1 + 5 = 6

question: Tarun gives Hari a head-start of 60 seconds in a 2400 m race and still beats him by 40 seconds. If the speed of Hari is 6 m/s, find the speed of Tarun.
solution:
(a) Given , Speed of Hari = 6m/s
Distance travelled in 60 sec = 360m

Tarun Hari
Distance → 2400 2040
Time → T T + 40
Speed = Distance Time ⇒ 6 = 2040T+40
⇒ 6T = 2040 - 240 = 1800
⇒ T = 300 sec
∴ Tarun’s speed = 2400300 = 8m/s

question: Which composite number can divide the sum of the first 12 natural numbers?
solution:
(a)
Sum of first n natural number = n(n+1)2
Sum of first 12 natural number = 12(12+1)2= 6 × 13
Hence, 6 can divide the sum of first 12 natural numbers.

question: The cost of painting a spherical vessel of diameter 14 cm is ₹21,560. What is the cost of painting (in ₹) per square centimetre ? (Use π = 227)
solution:
(d)
T.S.A. of spherical vessel = 4πr2 = 4 × 227× 7 × 7 = 616 cm2
Cost per square centimeter = total costT.S.A = 21,560616 = 35 Rs.

question:
The Least Common Multiple of two prime numbers x and y, (x<y) is 145. Then what is the value of (10x - y)?

\n
solution:
(b) According to question,
x × y = 145 = 5 × 29
(5 and 29 are prime no’s)
⇒ x = 5, y = 29
10x - y = 10 × 5 - 29 = 21

question: A cone of slant height 4.2 units has a lateral surface area 13.2 units2. The radius of the base is:
solution:
(a)
Lateral surface area = πrl
13.2 = 227× r × 4.2
13.2 =22×r×0.6
r = 13.213.2 = 1 unit

question: if tan θ = 58, then find the value of (1+cosθ)(1-cosθ)(1+sinθ)(1-sinθ).
solution:
(c) Given, tan θ = 58
(1+cosθ)(1-cosθ)(1+sinθ)(1-sinθ)
1-cos2θ1-sin2θ = sin2θcos2θ = tan2θ = (58)2 = 2564

question: R wishes to use a stick of length 6 units as common internal tangent to two circles of radius two units and three units. What can be the maximum distance (in units) between the centres of the circle?
solution:
(d)
Concept used :
For maximum distance between the centres of the circle, we need to draw the transverse common tangent .
For the minimum distance between the centres of the circle , we need to draw the direct common tangent.

Let the maximum distance between the centres be ‘L’
Transverse common tangent = L2-(R+r)2
6 = L2-(3+2)2 = L2-52
36 = L2 - 25
61 = L2
⇒ L = 61 Units

question: A retailer purchased a batch of goods for ₹5,000. Due to a manufacturing defect, 5% of the goods were damaged. If the retailer wants to make a profit of 20% on the remaining goods, at what price should the undamaged goods be sold?
solution:
(b)
Required price = 5000 × 1920 × 65= ₹5,700

question: The value of sin230° - sin240° + sin245° - sin255° - sin235° + sin245° - sin250° + sin260° is:
solution:
(d) sin230° - sin240° + sin245° - sin255° - sin235° + sin245° - sin250° + sin260°
= (sin230° + sin260°) - (sin240° + sin250°) + (sin245° + sin245°) - (sin255°+ sin235°)
= 1 - 1 + 1 - 1 (∵ sin2θ + sin2(90° - θ) = 1)
= 0

question: The difference between the compound interest (compounding half yearly) for 1 year and the simple interest for 1 year on a certain sum lent out at the annual rate of 30 percent is Rs. 337.5. What is the sum?
solution:
(a)
Rate for 12year = 302= 15%
CI for 1 year (2 cycle) at 15% = (15+15 + 152100)% = 30+2.25 = 32.25%
SI for 1 year = 30%
(CI - SI) for 1 year = 32.25% - 30% = 2.25% of P
337.5 = 2.25100P
P = 337.5×1002.25 = ₹15,000

question: In ∆PQR, S and T are the midpoints of the sides PQ and PR, respectively. The length of the side QR is 12 cm. If ST is parallel to QR, then find the length (in cm) of ST.
solution:
(c)

S and T are the mid-point of PQ and PR respectively.
Hence, by mid-point theorem
ST = 12 of QR
ST = 12 × 12 = 6 cm

question: In a class with a certain number of students, if one student weighing 30 kg is added, then the average weight of the class increases by 1 kg. If one more student weighing 30 kg is added, then the average weight of the class increases by 1.5 kg over the original average. What is the original average weight (in kg) of the class ?
solution:
(c)
Let number of student be n and their average weight be x kg
According to the question,
one student weighing 30 kg is added, then the average weight of the class increases by 1 kg
nx+30n+1 = x + 1
nx + 30 = nx + x + n+1
x + n = 29
n = 29 - x -----(i)
and, If one more student weighing 30 kg is added, then the average weight of the class increases by 1.5 kg over the original average
nx+60n+2 = x + 1.5
nx + 60 = nx + 2x + 1.5n + 3
1.5n + 2x = 57------(ii)
Putting the value of n from equation (i) to (ii) we get;
1.5(29 - x) + 2x = 57
43.5 + 0.5x = 57
x = 27 kg
Hence, original average weight of class = 27 kg

question: In an election, the winner was supported by 46% of all the voters in the list, and he got 410 votes more than his only rival.10% of the voters on the voters’ list did not cast their votes, and 60 voters cast their ballot papers blank. How many voters were on the list?
solution:
(c)
Let the no of voters on the list be 100x
No of valid votes = 100x × 90% - 60 = (90x - 60)
Votes received by winner = 100x × 46% = 46x
Votes received by loser = (90x - 60) - 46x = (44x - 60)
According to question,
46x - (44x - 60) = 410
2x + 60 = 410
2x = 350
x = 3502= 175
So, the no of voters on the list = 100x = 100 × 175 = 17500

question: For what value of k, the system of equations kx - 15y + 7 = 0 and 7x - 21y - 19 = 0 has NO solution?
solution:
(a) Given equation, kx - 15y + 7 = 0 and 7x - 21y - 19 = 0
There is no solution = a1a2 = b1b2 ≠ c1c2
Then,
⇒ k7= -15-21
⇒ k = 5

question: A boat can travel 78 km upstream and back in a total of 32 hours. It can travel 15 km upstream and 52 km downstream in a total of 9 hours. How much distance will the boat cover in 12 hours in still water?
solution:
(b) Let the speed of a boat be x km/h and the speed of a stream be y km/h
78x+y + 78x-y = 32 …….(i)
52x+y + 15x-y = 9 …….(ii)
We will assume that (x + y = 13) and (x - y = 3) satisfies the equation (i) and (ii)
Then,
x+y = 13 …….(iii)
x-y = 3 ……..(iv)
Add equation (iii) and (iv), we get
2x = 16
x = 8 km/h
Now,
Distance covered by boat in still water = 12 × 8 = 96 km

question: What is the mean proportional between (6 - 22) and (9 + 32)?
solution:
(d)
Mean proportion = (6-22) (9+32)
= 54+182-182-12
= 42

question: The quantity of milk in a mixture of milk and water is 45 of the volume of the mixture. After adding 1 liter of milk to 5 liters of the mixture, the percentage of water in the mixture is:
solution:
(d)
Mixture → Milk : Water
5 liter → 4 liter : 1 liter
↓+1 lit. : ↓+0 lit.
Final → 5 liter : 1 liter
Percentage of water in final mixture = 16×100% = 1006%

question: Sapna finishes a job in 12 hours working alone. If Sapna and Riya finish the same job in 8 hours working together at their respective constant rates, then, in how many hours can Riya do the job working alone?
solution:
(d)

Efficiency of Riya = 3 - 2 = 1 unit
Time taken by Riya = 241 = 24 hours

question: A part of the journey is covered in 22.5 minutes at a speed of 68 km/h and the remaining part in 12 minutes at a speed of 72 km/h. The total distance of the journey is (to the nearest integer):
solution:
(d)
Total distance = 68 × 22.560 + 72 × 1260= 25.5 + 14.4 = 40 km (approx)

question:
Parts of the following sentence have been given as options. Select the option that contains an error.
Ramayana is an ancient Sanskrit epic; it is believed to be written around 500 BC to 100 BC.
solution:
(a) Ramayana is an ancient
The definite article 'the' is used before holy books. For example:- The Ramayana, The Mahabharata, The Quran, The Bible, etc. Hence, 'The Ramayana is an ancient' is the most appropriate answer.

question:

I stirred the hornet’s nest by my honest statement.

Example- His remarks about lack of good women officers in the Army stirred up a hornet's nest.

question:

They cooked a conspiracy to overthrow the monarch.
solution:

‘Hatched a conspiracy’ is an idiom that means to plan something secretly.

question:
Choose the most appropriate option to change the narration (direct/indirect) of the given sentence:
He said, “Get your coat, Mohan”.
option_4: He told Mohan to get his coat
solution:
(d) He told Mohan to get his coat.
(a) He said to get his coat. (Listener is missing)
(b) He asked Mohan for his coat. (Incorrect Reporting Verb)
(c) He told Mohan get his coat. (Incorrect joining word)

question:

Cultivation of trees and vegetables
solution:

(b) Sericulture - the production of silk and the rearing of silkworms for this purpose.
(d) Multiculture - multiculture is something that incorporates ideas, beliefs or people from many different countries and cultural backgrounds.

question:
Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined word in the given sentence.
The culprit had been shot from the back by the police inspector.

Here, ‘in’ will be used to indicate that the bullet that was shot by the police inspector hit the back of the culprit. Hence, ‘in’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: May you be blessed with good health!

Structure)

question: This unfair proposal is objected to by us.
option_4: We have objected to this unfair proposal.
solution:

(a) We are objecting this unfair proposal. (Incorrect Tense)
(c) We object this unfair proposal. (Preposition ‘to’ is missing)
(d) We have objected to this unfair proposal. (Incorrect Tense)

question:
Select the most appropriate synonym of the given word.
Indigent
solution:
(b) Impoverished- lacking financial resources.
Indigent- extremely poor or needy.
Bust- a failure or collapse, often financial.
Affluent- wealthy or having an abundance of resources.
Low- less than average in amount, extent, or quality.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) The term ecology denotes the web of physical and biological systems and processes of which humans are one element.
(B)Mountains and rivers, plains and oceans, and the flora and fauna that they support, are a part of ecology.
(C )The ecology of a place is also affected by the interaction between its geography and hydrology.
(D)All societies have an ecological basis.
solution:
85 (c) DABC
Sentence D will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e.All societies have an ecological basis. And, Sentence A states what the term ecology denotes. So, A will follow D. Further, Sentence B states the parts of ecology & Sentence C states how the ecology of a place is affected. So, C will follow B. Going through the options, option (c) has the correct sequence.

question: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
solution:
(c) Advertisment
‘Advertisement’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
A vicious cycle
option_1: a situation in which one problem creates another one, making the original problem easy to forget.
option_2: a situation in which several problems merge and become one extremely complex problem.
option_3: a situation in which one problem causes another one, making the first one easy to solve.
option_4: a situation in which one problem causes another one, making the original problem impossible to solve
solution:
(d) A vicious cycle - a situation in which one problem causes another one, making the original problem impossible to solve.
E.g.- Stress can lead to lack of sleep, and lack of sleep causes more stress—a vicious cycle that's hard to break.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) These were Indian girls, in stiff shoes and closely clinging dresses.
(B) A paleface woman, with white hair, came up after us.
(C ) We were placed in a line of girls who were marching into the dining room.
(D) The small girls wore sleeved aprons and shingled hair.
solution:
(d) BCAD
Sentence B will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e. A paleface woman coming upto them. Sentence C states that they were placed in a line of girls who were marching into the dining room. So, C will follow B. Further, Sentence A states that these were Indian girls, in stiff shoes and closely clinging dresses and Sentence D states what the small girls wore .
So, D
will follow A. Going through the options, option (d) BCAD has the correct sequence.

question:

question:
Cloze Test
A series of ______ (96) of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. A necklace __________ (97) three pendants bunched together and a few bangles above the elbow and ________ (98) on the right hands display an almost modern art. She speaks of the ______ (99), ever hopeful human spirit. She reminds us that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the _____ (100) that a work of art leaves on our senses, to find among all the riches one particular vision of beauty that speaks to us alone.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 96.
solution:
(a) bangles
‘Bangles’ means a ring of glass or metal worn around the wrist as an ornament. The given passage states that a series of bangles of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. Hence, ‘bangles’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test
A series of ______ (96) of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. A necklace __________ (97) three pendants bunched together and a few bangles above the elbow and ________ (98) on the right hands display an almost modern art. She speaks of the ______ (99), ever hopeful human spirit. She reminds us that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the _____ (100) that a work of art leaves on our senses, to find among all the riches one particular vision of beauty that speaks to us alone.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 97.
solution:
(b) with
‘With’ means having or including something as a part. The given passage states that a necklace with three pendants punched together and a few bangles above the elbow and wrist on the right hands display an almost modern art. Hence, ‘with’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test
A series of ______ (96) of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. A necklace __________ (97) three pendants bunched together and a few bangles above the elbow and ________ (98) on the right hands display an almost modern art. She speaks of the ______ (99), ever hopeful human spirit. She reminds us that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the _____ (100) that a work of art leaves on our senses, to find among all the riches one particular vision of beauty that speaks to us alone.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 98.
solution:
(d) wrist
‘Wrist’ is the joint between the hand and the arm. The given passage states that a necklace with three pendants punched together and a few bangles above the elbow and wrist on the right hands display an almost modern art. Hence, ‘wrist’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test
A series of ______ (96) of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. A necklace __________ (97) three pendants bunched together and a few bangles above the elbow and ________ (98) on the right hands display an almost modern art. She speaks of the ______ (99), ever hopeful human spirit. She reminds us that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the _____ (100) that a work of art leaves on our senses, to find among all the riches one particular vision of beauty that speaks to us alone.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 99.
solution:
(a) undaunted
‘Undaunted’ means not frightened or discouraged by difficulty, danger, or disappointment. The given passage states that she speaks of the undaunted, ever hopeful human spirit. Hence, ‘undaunted’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test
A series of ______ (96) of shell or ivory or thin metal clothed her left upper arm all the way down to her fingers. A necklace __________ (97) three pendants bunched together and a few bangles above the elbow and ________ (98) on the right hands display an almost modern art. She speaks of the ______ (99), ever hopeful human spirit. She reminds us that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the _____ (100) that a work of art leaves on our senses, to find among all the riches one particular vision of beauty that speaks to us alone.
Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 100.
solution:
(a) impact
‘Impact’ means a strong impression or effect that something has on a person. The given passage states that it is important to visit museums in our country to experience the impact that a work of art leaves on our senses. Hence, ‘effect’ is the most appropriate answer.
